title: Find out how your MP voted as Boris Johnson secures 12 December poll in fourth general election bid
text:
MPs have backed an early general election on 12 December 2019 after Boris Johnson pushed for it for a fourth time in Parliament.

The original plan to get MPs to back it under the Fixed-term Parliaments Act Act was scrapped due to the fact that it required two-third of all MPs to back it.

The Government then brought back a standard one-line bill which only required a simple majority, which in the end got support from two-thirds of MPs. Some 438 MPs voted for an early election and 20 voted against - a majority of 418.

A general election on 12 December will now be called, and the country will start its fourth major national poll in five years.

You can see how each MP voted in the motion in our...
description: MPs have backed an early general election on 12 December 2019 after Boris Johnson pushed for it for a fourth time in Parliament.
